If you have any frozen corn on hand, you’ve gotta try this Skillet Roasted Corn tonight! No exaggeration, it’s the best way to eat corn ever. Also consistently one of the top recipes on our site! 
 
Recipe: https://borrowedbites.com/skillet-roasted-corn/

Supreme Chicken filled with Desiccated Coconut

Ingredients:
- 1 Chicken Breast
- 100g Minced Chicken
- 150g Desiccated Coconut
- 20ml Kara Coconut Cream
- 1 Whole Egg
- 10g Cooking Oil

Method:
1, Mix minced chicken meat, whole egg, desiccated coconut and coconut cream together. Stuff mixture into chicken breast.
2, Season chicken breast with salt. Pan-fry till crispy before baking in oven till cooked.
3, Slice cooked chicken into half and arrange on a plate with some vegetables.

My pressure cooked Bean Stew.  
With kidney beans. Sauteed Onion, caramelised, garlic, White cabbage, potato,  tomato..salt,  light soya sauce. Chili flakes. Olive oil. Pressure cooked for 20 minutes. Nice. Will eat it with brown rice.

Crazy Easy Peanut Butter and Banana Sandwich with Strawberries and Nutella - The sandwich for kids


Ingredients:
2 Slices of Bread, Peanut Butter, Banana, Strawberries, and Nutella

Preparation:
If using a loaf of bread unsliced - slice bread roughly 3/4" thick
Slice Banana (1/2 Banana Per Sandwich)
Slice Strawberries (2-3 Strawberries Per Sandwich)

How To:
Spread Nutella on 1 of the slices of Bread
Spread Peanut Butter on other slice of bread
Place Bananas and Strawberries on one of the slices of bread
Put other slice on top 
Heat a fry pan up (low to medium heat), place a Tsb or so of butter in pan to melt, once butter melt place sandwich in pan. Press down on sandwich and flip a few times not allowing bread to burn but to provide enough heat to heat up the peanut butter and nutella......a panini press would work very well. Once you feel sandwich is warm enough take out, cut in half and finish with icing sugar (powdered sugar)..........ENJOY!

Making this today. It's in the oven right now and the sweet cinnamon is smelling so good!

I’ve been making this Cinnamon Coffee Cake recipe for many years now. I usually make it during the holidays, but really, it’s delicious any time of year. It’s moist, packed with cinnamon and pecans.

My husband loves it, especially with a big glass of ice-cold milk. ❤

Coconut Crusty Bread

Ingredient A:
- 500g Bread Flour
- 100ml Creamed Coconut (paste)
- 1g Fine Salt
- 25g Sugar
- 1 Whole Egg
- 50g Roasted Cashew (chopped)
- 30g Milk Powder
- 15g Dried Yeast

Ingredient B:
- Around 150-200ml water

Ingredient C:
- 50g Desiccated Coconut (roasted)

Method:
1, Put Ingredient A into a mixing bowl.
2, Pour in water and bled into a dough.
3, Divide dough into portions of 2. Rest them for 1 hour.
4, Mold them round after 1 hour.
5, Brush with egg white and coat the top with desiccated coconut.
6, Rest for 1 hour then bake at 200C/ 395F for 20-25 minutes.

Sweet Potato Leaves in Coconut Milk

Ingredient A:
- 400g Sweet Potato Leaves
- 300g Prawns
- 20g Tamarind

Ingredient B:
- 100g Shallots
- 50g Chilies
- 15g Dried Chilies
- 10g Belacan

Ingredient C:
- 200ml Kara Coconut Cream

Method:
1, Saute Ingredient B till fragrant. Add prawn stock and tamarind. Bring to boil then add sweet potatoes and simmer till potatoes soften.
2, Add Ingredient C and bring to boil then add sweet potato leaves and prawn. Simmer for 1-2 minutes.

My first try Roast Turkey 
Ingredients:
Medium Turkey 
Pork Stuffing in neck cavity 
Orange, onion, rosemary in tail cavity 
Vege underneath function as rack
Butter mixture: 150g butter, 3tsp salt, bunch of ground black pepper, 3tsp dry thyme, 6 tsp dry rosemary 
Bake: 170 degree bake for 2.5 hours. First 2 hrs with foil cover. Last 30mins take out the foil and brush some more butter. Last 10mins I have also brushed some honey

Smoked Pork Chops with Char Siu BBQ Sauce.
I was gifted a new smoker for Christmas.
I was lucky enough to find a rack of pork at a great price. Instead of cooking it like a crown roast, I cut double chops and butterflied them, marinated the meat, grilled the chops quick on high heat to get a light char, then smoked them with apple wood soaked in whiskey and water. I brushed on homemade Char Siu BBQ sauce every ten minutes until finished.

Homemade chicken and dumplings for this cold day!

••1.5 lbs chicken tenderloins  
••4 cups chicken stock  
••1 can cream of chicken soup  
••1 tsp salt  
••1 1\2 tsp pepper  
••1 cup half and half  
••1 tsp rosemary  
••1\2 tsp thyme  
••8 oz each carrots and corn, drained  
••1 1\2 cups baking mix  
••1\2 cup milk

Boil or steam chicken until done and shred.  
Combine stock, soup, half and half, salt, pepper, rosemary, and thyme, bring to a boil, add chicken and veggies, reduce heat to medium and cook for 10 min.  
Meanwhile, combine the baking mix and milk and drop by spoonful on top of chicken mixture. Cook uncovered for 10 min, then cook and cook 10 to 15 more min

Chicken, Shrimp and Vegetable Gumbo
Ingredients

1 pound medium shrimp peeled
2 cans of stew tomatoes 12 or 14 ounce
1 1/2 chicken thighs skinless, boneless, cut into 1 inch pieces
1 1/2 cup of diced green pepper
1 cup of diced onion
1 cup of celery, chopped
1/4 cup of flour
1/4 cup canola oil
1 clove of garlic, chopped
1 Tbs Old Bay seasoning
1 tsp garlic powder
1/2 tsp salt
3 cups of water
4 bay leaves
1 Tbs of hot sauce

Prep

Lightly spoon flour into a dray measuring cup; With lid off a 6 quart Instant Pot, press [Saute'] and use [Adjust] to select Normal mode.

Combine flour and oil in cooker; cook 5 minutes stirring constantly with a flat spatula until dark brown.

Add bell pepper, onion, celery and garlic; cook 3 minutes, stirring frequently. Stir in three cups of water, Old Bay, garlic powder, salt, tomatoes, chicken and bay leaves.

Turn cooker off. Close and lock the lid of the Instant Pot. Turn the steam release handle to "Sealing" position. Press [Manual]; select "High Pressure," and use [-] or [+] to choose 23 minutes pressure cooking time. When time is up, turn cooker off. Open the cooker using Natural Pressure release.

Stir in hot sauce and press [Saute'], and use [adjust] to select "More" mode. Cook uncovered 5 minutes stirring occasionally. Add shrimp; cook minutes. Remove and discard bay leaves.

Serves 6 - 8

Made this tonight and it was a winner!

Ingredients

1 tbsp olive oil
1 medium red onion, diced
2 tbsp minced garlic
1.5 lbs of chicken breasts
1 - 14.5oz can of fire roasted tomatoes
1 - 6oz. can of tomato paste
1 - 4oz. can of mild green chiles
1 - 15 oz. can of black beans
1 - 15 oz. can of pinto beans
1 - 15 oz. can of red kidney beans
8 oz. chicken stock
1 tbsp chili powder
1 tbsp garlic powder
½ tbsp smoked paprika
1 tsp cumin
1 tsp onion powder
1 tsp salt
1 tsp ground pepper
2 bay leaves

Directions

A) Turn on your Instant Pot, utilizing the sauté setting. Add olive oil. Allow cooking oil to heat up for one minute before adding onion and garlic.
Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Onions should be starting to turn translucent.
While cooking the onions and garlic, chop chicken into 2 inch pieces (this will make it easier to shred after cooking).
 😎  Combine seasonings into small bowl. Mix well.
Turn off sauté setting and add chicken. Cover with seasoning and mix well.
C) Pour beans, chilies, and tomatoes on top. Add tomato paste. Mix well.
Add chicken stock and bay leaves, cover and lock lid.
Set Instant Pot on high pressure for 4 minutes. Allow pot to naturally release for 10 minutes before opening lid.

https://bringmethenews.com/minnesota-lifestyle/recipe-break-in-your-instant-pot-with-this-smoky-chicken-chili

Stuffed Peppers

I'm sure there is already a recipe here somewhere but I found one on Food Network that I tweaked to my own liking and it's one of my favorites!

6 green bell peppers, tops cut away and seeds removed  
2 tbsp veg oil  
1 cup chopped onion  
1/2 cup chopped green peppers (I use the tops that I cut off the peppers)  
1/2 pound ground turkey (or beef if you prefer)  
1/2 pound ground Italian sausage  
1 tbsp minced garlic  
1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley  
3/4 tsp salt  
1/2 tsp black pepper  
Pinch red pepper flakes  
2 cups cooked rice  
8 oz tomato sauce  
Mozz cheese  
1/2 pound maple bacon  
1 can diced tomatoes with green chilis (optional)

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees

1. In a large pot of boiling water, parboil the peppers until just tender, 2 to 3 minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon and dry on paper towels.

2. On a sheet pan, cook the bacon in the oven at 350 degrees for 30 minutes and drain on paper towels.

3. Cook the rice according to pkg directions

4. In a large sautée pan, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the onions and chopped bell peppers and cook until soft. Add the turkey (or beef), sausage, garlic, parsley, salt, black pepper, and pepper flakes. Cook until meat is browned and break up the lumps. Crumble the cooked bacon and add to the pan. Add the rice and tomato sauce and stir well. Remove from the heat and adjust the seasoning to taste.

5. Pour about 1/8 inch of water into a baking dish, stuff the peppers with the mixture and add to the baking dish. Sprinkle the top of the peppers with mozz cheese. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

6. Remove from the oven and let rest for 10 minutes before serving.

7 OPTIONAL - Top the pepper with a couple spoonfuls of diced tomatoes with green chilis before serving.

Blooming Onions  
Dry mix  
2c flour  
1T cajun seasoning  
1t paprika  
1/4t salt

Wet mix  
1.5c milk  
2 eggs

Trim both ends on large onion slice leaving 1/2 inch to 1 inch (I sit my onion in a canning jar ring and cut) gentle separate onion and dust with dry mix shake off extra then dredge in wet mix and once more in dry mix shake off excess chill in freezer for 30 minutes then fry in 400° oil till golden.

Instant Pot Chicken Noodle Soup

Prep Time: 5 min
Cook Time: 40 min

INGREDIENTS

2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
1 small onion
4 cloves of garlic, roughly minced
1 bay leaf
1-2 medium carrots
1 celery stalk
5-6 cups chicken stock
1 tablespoon olive oil
8 ounces of noodles of your choice (shell, rotelle, etc.)
Kosher salt
Ground black pepper

PREPARATION

Cut chicken into desired size for consumption or shred after cooking
Dice onions, carrots and celery into spoon sized bites
Mince garlic
Set 1 cup of chicken stock to the side

A)
Set Instant Pot to Saute' setting
Add olive oil, garlic and onion and cook for desired texture (3-4 minutes)
Pour 1/3 cup of chicken stock and with a wooden spoon scrub brown bits off the skillet bottom
Add carrots, celery, bay leaf, salt and pepper to taste
Pour in remaining 2/3 cup of chicken stock
Submerge chicken breasts into pressure cooker. Close lid

 😎 
Set Instant Pot to High Pressure for 7 minutes
Release pressure of IP, then open lid
Remove bay leaf and shred chicken if desired

C)
Pour in remaining 4-5 cups of chicken stock, add noodles and set IP to saute'
Cook all ingredients until desired noodle texture is met

Let cool and eat

https://www.pressurecookrecipes.com/pressure-cooker-chicken-noodle-soup/

IP Instant Pot Beef Stew

Ingredients

1 1/2 Pounds of Beef Stew Meat
1 TBS Olive Oil
1 Tps Salt
1 Tps Pepper
1 Tps Italian Seasoning
2 TBS Worcestershire Sauce
3 Cloves Garlic, Minced
1 Large Onion, Chopped
1 16 Ounce Bag Baby Carrots cut Into Slices
1 16 ounce can of tomato sauce
1 Pound Potatoes cubed
2 1/2 Cups Beef Broth
2 TBS Cornstarch
2 TBS Water

Prep

1. Add olive oil to instant pot set to saute`. When the oil starts to sizzle add garlic and onions. When the onions become soft, 3-5 minutes, add the meat.

2. Cook meat until browned on all sides.

3. Add just one cup of broth to instant pot and with a wooden spoon scrape brown bits from bottom of the pan.

4. Add Worcestershire sauce, carrots, potatoes, tomato sauce and remaining beef broth.

5. Close lid and steam valve on instant pot setting to cook on high pressure for 35 minutes. Let set for 10 minutes before doing a quick release.

6. Mix together cornstarch and cold water in a small bowl and stir into the stew until thickened.

https://thesaltymarshmallow.com/best-ever-instant-pot-beef-stew/

I was inspired by another group here on MeWe when I saw a stuffed mushroom recipe using Alouette cheese spread and imitation crab.  
When I went to the store, they had an artichoke and jalapeno dip on sale so I took a gamble.  
I tried the two together yesterday and the stuffing slipped right off (you all likely knew that. I'm a very basic cook). So I added Panko today to bind things together better.  Turned out perfect! The flavors went well together, had a little spice to it...super easy and will impress! Might be fun for Thanksgiving!

My first attempt at Jambalaya. Threw everything in the crockpot and walked away. Yum! 
1 onion
1 green pepper
1 red pepper
4 stalks celery
1 smoked sausage sliced
1 rotisserie chicken shredded
1 can tomato sauce
1 qt chicken broth
1 can crushed tomatoes
Cajun seasoning
Added a bag of shrimp during the last 30 minutes.
